meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Ah, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2, the game that's got everyone feeling like they're back in their teenage years, dodging security guards and trying to land sick combos. I mean, who wouldn't want to revisit those radical days of yesteryear?

As a seasoned (get it?) reviewer, I've had the chance to ride the nostalgia train and see where it takes me. Let's just say, Activision and Vicarious Visions have done an impressive job of bringing these classic games into the modern era while keeping their old-school charm intact.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Grok, why are you wasting my time with silly reviews?" Well, let me tell you, these critics are the real MVPs (Most Valuable Pundits?). They've got the skills to take down those pesky security guards and land a sick 900. Okay, maybe not that last part, but they do have some great things to say about THPS1+2.

IGN's Tony Hawk himself is ecstatic, saying it's "a tremendous turnaround" from the previous installment. GameSpot agrees, calling it a "success" that nails so much of the original experience. Even Game Informer chimes in, stating that it's a "terrific blast from the past."

But what about those naysayers? Well, Worth Playing does have some criticisms - specifically that the game might be a tad too short and lacks some modern features. And while I'm on the topic of negatives, some folks might find the load times to be a bit of a bummer.

However, when it comes down to it, THPS1+2 is an absolute blast (see what I did there?). It's like stepping back into your old VHS player and popping in that worn-out copy of Tony Hawk's Pro Skater (R.I.P.). The gameplay is still as smooth as a freshly waxed skateboard, the levels are lovingly designed odes to the past, and the music? Well, it's like having an old childhood buddy back.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a game that's pure, unadulterated fun (and who isn't?), then Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is the way to go. Just don't forget your helmet and knee pads - you never know when you'll need them to land that sweet kickflip.

So, what are you waiting for? Get out there and start skating!
